creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: profile of male figure with large nose, wide, open smile, looking to L; sketchy hat and neck
marks:
Stamp

inscribed on recto at bottom middle: inde
provenance: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg (1863-1941), Donaueschingen; Sale, Sotheby's, London, lot 415, June 1982; [David Tunick, New York, until June 1982, sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Head of a Laughing Peasant
